intro: Pimpinella buchananii var. triradiata, commonly known as the three-rayed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, white flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are pinnately divided with a distinctive three-rayed pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The species is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance to local pollinators.
